> RIOT laks any definition of what is abusive or insulting or toxic.
It is all SUBJECTIVE and therefore, i dont see that i did anything wrong.

The standards decided upon are subjective, as what is "right and wrong" is decided by the community. The rules to follow those standards are objective; you follow them or you get the boot (though there is subjective leeway to your benefit, not detriment). You don't have to personally agree with what the rest of the community and Riot has decided upon, you merely have to follow suit. You are free to express your opinion on the matter and make a movement to affect change towards your beliefs on the matter, but concerning your positions expressed here the vast majority of other players don't want any part of it.

> Moreover they don't punish feeders or people who abuse the report system.

They do punish feeders. There is an automated system to detect those too, but it's not perfect; it is much harder to determine someone is committing gameplay offenses intentionally rather than just playing poorly, than it is to parse chat logs for common offensive language and phrases.

As for abusing the report system, what abuse? The system is designed around tossing out false reports and lowering their report value; all reports do is flag the system to check that player's match when a case review is triggered. Premade reports also do not stack to increase the chance of a case review, and multiple reports in a match can't make the system check it any harder either.

> RIOT seems not to care, the only thing it seems to care about is that people act like robots.

People in general are typically not going to be receptive to anything said from a person verbally attacking them. You don't need to give them emotionless responses, you just need to not flame them. If you can't think of a way to write your message in a positive and productive manner, try to remain neutral. If you can't even do that, just don't say anything, because you'll probably just make things worse. I recommend muting players that decide to get toxic back at you if they aren't receptive to your neutral/positive well-meaning chat.

Punishments are given out on a 4-strike system.

Strike1: 10-game chat restriction.
Strike2: 25-game chat restriction.
Strike3: 2-week ban.
Strike4: Permanent ban.

Whenever you are reported it triggers a review of your account. If it's found that you consistently show negative and poor behavior across multiple games then you receive the next step up the punishment ladder (except in extreme cases where chat restrictions get skipped (i.e. death threats, racist comments, intentional gameplay trolling, etc.)). On the flipside if nothing rule-breaking is found then the report is deemed false and thrown out, and the reporter has their report weight and value lowered. If you show enough of a reformation effort (~3 months time give or take) then you can drop down punishment levels.

As for your punishment, this was a question of "is this punishment worthy?" to which the answer is yes. You constantly verbally abused and harassed your teammates in all three games non-stop. Your teammates didn't like that (and whether they took offense to it or not is something that only they know for sure), hence why they reported you. Those reports triggered a review of your account and found out that you were still acting up and hadn't changed. Because of that, the system determined that you deserved another punishment, which in this case was a permanent ban. From [Ulanopo's Knowledge Base](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4086541&page=4#post43467878): 

>**Is there any way to remove my permaban?**

>Keep in mind that we dont have the power to remove your ban. Only Riot has that ability.

>BANS THAT CANNOT BE LIFTED
* Behavioral
* Tampering with the game client
* DDOS
* Real-life harassment, threats or stalking
* Elo boosting

>BANS THAT MIGHT BE LIFTED
* Inappropriate name
* Payment problems

If you truly valued your account then you should have thought of that before you got permabanned.

For all your bluster, you failed to follow simple, straightforward rules. Thus, you were punished. That's going to be true in one form or another for most things you do in life, so it's good that you're learning it now.
